properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Brighton, Brighton East, Caulfield South, Gardenvale
properties.webBody:
This message is being issued for Brighton, Brighton East, Caulfield South, Gardenvale.

  • There is a building fire in Oxford St, Brighton.
  • The fire is under control.
  • You may see or smell smoke. 
  • Emergency Services are in attendance. 
  • The following road is closed: Oxford St.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Fire Rescue Victoria.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.

Health information:

  • If you need medical advice for exposure to smoke, seek medical advice or call Nurse on Call on 1300 606 024.
  • Anyone experiencing wheezing, chest tightness and difficulty breathing should call Triple Zero (000).

Use multiple sources to stay informed:

  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV
properties.text:
COMMUNITY INFORMATION - STRUCTURE FIRE
Incident Location: Oxford St, Brighton East
Issue Date: Monday 03 January 2022, 02:07 pm
Next Update: Monday 03 January 2022, 03:10 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/19514/moreinfo

This message is being issued for Brighton, Brighton East, Caulfield South, Gardenvale.

- There is a building fire in Oxford St, Brighton.
- The fire is under control.
- You may see or smell smoke. 
- Emergency Services are in attendance. 
- The following road is closed: Oxford St.


There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
The Threat is Reduced following the grassfire at Langkoop, Poolaijelo, Powers Creek. 

  • The fire is still burning within small areas of private Plantation near Ryans Road. Fire spread has been stopped with fire crews patrolling containment lines around the fire. Crews and heavy machinery will continue to work today.
  • Surrounding communities may see smoke from fire activity but the threat to private property has reduced. 
People located within Langkoop, Poolaijelo, Powers Creek are now able to resume normal activities.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Emergency services will remain in the area, smoke will be visible from nearby communities and roads.  

The following roads are closed:  
  • Casterton-Apsley Road between Dergholm-Edenhope Road and Edenhope-Penola Road.  
  • Fergusons Road, west of Powers Creek. 

Roadside tree risks 
Firefighters are continuing to assess hazardous trees along roadsides. A number of large gum trees continuing to burn, local Residents should remain cautious of hazardous trees in the area. 

Stock and livestock 
Agriculture Victoria is available to support fire-affected farmers with animal welfare issues. If you have any animal welfare concerns or livestock that need to be assessed, please call Agriculture Victoria District Veterinary Officer Amy Sluggett on 0457 837 840. 

Rainwater tanks  
If you live in a bushfire affected area you should be aware that your rain water tanks could become contaminated from debris and ash or dead animals being flushed into your rainwater tank when it rains, or during fire protecting activity. Untreated water from these sources should not be used for drinking in any event.   Residents should contact West Wimmera Shire Council to request an Essential Water Replacement form or click on this link Essential Water Replacement form

Asbestos  
Bushfire damage to a building may affect the integrity of building materials and threaten your health. The presence of asbestos in damaged or destroyed properties is a concern. It can risk your health if the asbestos contaminated ash or debris is disturbed and you inhale it. More information is available at the www.health.gov.au
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.  

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires) 
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
ADVICE - GRASS FIRE - Threat Is Reduced
Incident Location: Poolaijelo
Issue Date: Monday 03 January 2022, 08:52 am
Next Update: Monday 03 January 2022, 04:00 pm

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/19507/moreinfo

The Threat is Reduced following the grassfire at Langkoop, Poolaijelo, Powers Creek. 

- The fire is still burning within small areas of private Plantation near Ryans Road. Fire spread has been stopped with fire crews patrolling containment lines around the fire. Crews and heavy machinery will continue to work today.
- Surrounding communities may see smoke from fire activity but the threat to private property has reduced. 


People located within Langkoop, Poolaijelo, Powers Creek are now able to resume normal activities.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message has been issued for Jarosite Headland, near Bells Beach.

  • Landslip and rockfall has occurred in the Jarosite Headland area.
Stay informed. Stay away from the area. The cliff may continue to move for hours or days afterwards.
What you should do:
  • Landslips and rockfalls are unpredictable and can occur without warning.
  • While the rest of the beach is open, visitors should take note of signage and advice from Parks Victoria staff in the area.
Impacts in your area:
  • A section of beach at Jarosite Headlands, between Point Addis and Southside, has been closed. 
This message was issued by Parks Victoria.

The next update is expected by 05/01/2022 02:30 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#viclandslide).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/19445/moreinfo

This Advice message has been issued for Jarosite Headland, near Bells Beach. 

- Landslip and rockfall has occurred in the Jarosite Headland area.


Stay informed. Stay away from the area. The cliff may continue to move for hours or days afterwards.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for The Honeysuckles.

  • Due to a whale carcass, there could be an increase in shark activity at The Honeysuckles near Ninety Mile Beach.
  • A whale carcass can attract sharks to the area and mean they are closer to the shore than normal.
  • While it is not uncommon for sharks to be present off the Victorian coast, you should exercise additional caution in the area.
  • The Victorian Fisheries Authority is assisting Wildlife Officers and Park Rangers with the management of the whale carcass.
  • This Advice message replaces the Advice issued on 22 December.
Stay informed and do not enter the water at closed beaches.
What you should do:
  • If you see sharks, report the sighting by calling Triple Zero (000) or notify lifesavers immediately if you are at a patrolled beach.

Staying safe at nearby beaches:
  • Always swim, dive or surf with a friend.
  • Swim between the red and yellow flags on patrolled beaches.
  • Don't swim in places where human or animal waste enters the water.
  • Keep away from large schools of fish, seals or other wildlife as these can attract sharks.
This message was issued by Victorian Fisheries Authority.

The next update is expected by 05/01/2022 03:00 pm or as the situation changes.

For more information on staying safe around sharks:
  • www.vfa.vic.gov.au/shark-smart.
Stay informed:
  • Via www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
  • Call the VicEmergency Hotline to talk to someone about this warning on 1800 226 226 (freecall).
  • People who are deaf, hard of hearing, or who have a speech/communication impairment can contact VicEmergency Hotline via the National Relay Service on 1800 555 677.
  • For help with English, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to telephone VicEmergency Hotline. If you know someone who cannot speak English, provide them with this number.
  • Download the VicEmergency app or follow VicEmergency on Twitter or Facebook.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.location: Maribyrnong, Aberfeldie, Avondale Heights, Essendon West
properties.webBody:
This Community Information is being issued for Aberfeldie, Avondale Heights, Essendon West, Maribyrnong.

  • There is a grassfire and building fire at Raleigh Rd, Maribyrnong, which has been burning since 01/01/2022.
  • The fire is under control.
  • Fire crews are still in attendance at the fire, monitoring and patrolling the fire.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Fire Rescue Victoria.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire.


Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.

Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Gardenvale, Brighton, Brighton East, Caulfield South, Elsternwick
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Brighton, Brighton East, Caulfield South, Elsternwick, Gardenvale.

  • There is a house fire in Oxford Street, Brighton. 
  • Smoke will be visible from nearby roads and communities. 
There is currently no threat to the community, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond. 
  • If you are sensitive to smoke or you live with someone who is sensitive to smoke you should close windows and doors. Turn off heating and cooling systems.
  • To prevent the smell of smoke entering your home or business you should close windows and doors.  
Impacts in your area: 
  • The following road is closed: Oxford Street, between Nepean Hwy and Clonaig St..
This message was issued by Fire Rescue Victoria.

The next update is expected by 03/01/2022 03:30 pm or as the situation changes.

Health information:

  • If you need medical advice for exposure to smoke, seek medical advice or call Nurse on Call on 1300 606 024.
  • Anyone experiencing wheezing, chest tightness and difficulty breathing should call Triple Zero (000).

Smoke information

  • Smoke can affect peopleâ€™s health.
  • People with heart or lung conditions (including asthma), children, pregnant women and older people are more sensitive to the effects of breathing in smoke.
  • People with existing heart or lung conditions (including asthma) should follow the treatment plan advised by the doctor.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Walkerville, Walkerville North, Walkerville South.

  • Due to a whale carcass, there could be an increase in shark activity at Walkerville North Beach. 
  • A whale carcass can attract sharks to the area and mean they are closer to the shore than normal.
  • While it is not uncommon for sharks to be present off the Victorian coast, you should exercise additional caution in the area.
  • The Victorian Fisheries Authority is assisting Park Rangers with the management of the whale carcass.
  • This Advice message replaces the Advice issued on 22 December.
Stay informed and do not enter the water at closed beaches.
What you should do:
  • If you see sharks, report the sighting by calling Triple Zero (000) or notify lifesavers immediately if you are at a patrolled beach.
  • Take extra caution in the area by swimming at patrolled beaches and not surfing or diving in the area.

Staying safe at nearby beaches:
  • Always swim, dive or surf with a friend.
  • Swim between the red and yellow flags on patrolled beaches.
  • Don't swim in places where human or animal waste enters the water.
  • Keep away from large schools of fish, seals or other wildlife as these can attract sharks.
This message was issued by Victorian Fisheries Authority.

The next update is expected by 05/01/2022 06:00 pm or as the situation changes.

For more information on staying safe around sharks:
  • www.vfa.vic.gov.au/shark-smart.
Stay informed:
  • Via www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
  • Call the VicEmergency Hotline to talk to someone about this warning on 1800 226 226 (freecall).
  • People who are deaf, hard of hearing, or who have a speech/communication impairment can contact VicEmergency Hotline via the National Relay Service on 1800 555 677.
  • For help with English, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to telephone VicEmergency Hotline. If you know someone who cannot speak English, provide them with this number.
  • Download the VicEmergency app or follow VicEmergency on Twitter or Facebook.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Barmah, Barmah East, Lower Moira, Yambuna, Picola
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Barmah, Barmah East, Lower Moira, Picola, Yambuna.

  • There is a bushfire at Yambuna that is under control.
  • People in the area of Lower Goulburn National Park should remain aware of the potential for smoke and fire.
  • Warm temperatures and windy conditions have been forecast for Monday.
  • This Advice message replaces the Watch and Act message issued at 7.34am.
There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.

Impacts in your area: 
  • Fire activity may increase with hot and windy weather conditions.
  • Smoke may still be visible from nearby communities and roads.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 04/01/2022 01:50 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
